update.description:
# Overview

Add the `UserCommands` system, which is meant to be the entry point for all user commands. This is just the beginning of the system, it eventually will:

* Provide a transport interface for **all commands** such as spawning, deleting, moving, etc.
* Provide a transport interface to **undo / redo** previous commands.
* Provide a transport interface to get a **history** of commands.

Right now, all it provides is a single command: spawn.

# Requirements

* Pull request #130 (merged)
* [ign-msgs 86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/86/a-6-refactor-factory/diff) (merged)
* [sdf 499](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/499/a-6-support-root/diff) (merged)

# Try it out

The instructions in `empty.sdf` should be enough, let me know if you need more instructions.

![spawn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2909024988-spawn.gif)

# Future work

The current architecture is inspired on Gazebo's [UserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/physics/UserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) and [MEUserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/gui/model/MEUserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default).

The intention is that undo / redo will work as described on [this design document](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/b84d3c4b82f666b2ef6a989032ac61530e1ee32f/undo/undo.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default); for that, we will need a way to store and restore simulation keyframes - this functionality is tied to the current development of simulation logging.
update.title: [A-6] User command: Spawn / factory / create

content.html: 5c7079f

content.raw: What do you think about renaming `UserCommand` to `UserCommandBase` to differentiate it more easily form `UserCommands` which is a system? It also makes it clear that it's the base class.
content.html: What do you think about renaming UserCommand to UserCommandBase to differentiate it more easily form UserCommands which is a system? It also makes it clear that it's the base class.

update.description:
# Overview

Add the `UserCommands` system, which is meant to be the entry point for all user commands. This is just the beginning of the system, it eventually will:

* Provide a transport interface for **all commands** such as spawning, deleting, moving, etc.
* Provide a transport interface to **undo / redo** previous commands.
* Provide a transport interface to get a **history** of commands.

Right now, all it provides is a single command: spawn.

# Requirements

* Pull request #130 (merged)
* [ign-msgs 86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/86/a-6-refactor-factory/diff) (merged)
* [sdf 499](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/499/a-6-support-root/diff) (merged)

# Try it out

The instructions in `empty.sdf` should be enough, let me know if you need more instructions.

![spawn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2909024988-spawn.gif)

# Future work

The current architecture is inspired on Gazebo's [UserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/physics/UserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) and [MEUserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/gui/model/MEUserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default).

The intention is that undo / redo will work as described on [this design document](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/b84d3c4b82f666b2ef6a989032ac61530e1ee32f/undo/undo.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default); for that, we will need a way to store and restore simulation keyframes - this functionality is tied to the current development of simulation logging.

# Overview

Add the `UserCommands` system, which is meant to be the entry point for all user commands. This is just the beginning of the system, it eventually will:

* Provide a transport interface for **all commands** such as spawning, deleting, moving, etc.
* Provide a transport interface to **undo / redo** previous commands.
* Provide a transport interface to get a **history** of commands.

Right now, all it provides is a single command: spawn.

* [sdf 499](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/499/a-6-support-root/diff) (merged)

![spawn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2909024988-spawn.gif)

The current architecture is inspired on Gazebo's [UserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/physics/UserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) and [MEUserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/gui/model/MEUserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default).

update.description:
# Overview

Add the `UserCommands` system, which is meant to be the entry point for all user commands. This is just the beginning of the system, it eventually will:

* Provide a transport interface for **all commands** such as spawning, deleting, moving, etc.
* Provide a transport interface to **undo / redo** previous commands.
* Provide a transport interface to get a **history** of commands.

Right now, all it provides is a single command: spawn.

# Requirements

* Pull request #130 (merged)
* [ign-msgs 86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/86/a-6-refactor-factory/diff) (merged)
* [sdf 499](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/499/a-6-support-root/diff) (merged)

# Try it out

The instructions in `empty.sdf` should be enough, let me know if you need more instructions.

![spawn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2909024988-spawn.gif)

# Future work

The current architecture is inspired on Gazebo's [UserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/physics/UserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) and [MEUserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/gui/model/MEUserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default).

The intention is that undo / redo will work as described on [this design document](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/b84d3c4b82f666b2ef6a989032ac61530e1ee32f/undo/undo.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default); for that, we will need a way to store and restore simulation keyframes - this functionality is tied to the current development of simulation logging.

* [sdf 499](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/499/a-6-support-root/diff) (merged)

The instructions in `empty.sdf` should be enough, let me know if you need more instructions.

![spawn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2909024988-spawn.gif)

# Future work

The current architecture is inspired on Gazebo's [UserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/physics/UserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) and [MEUserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/gui/model/MEUserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default).

The intention is that undo / redo will work as described on [this design document](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/b84d3c4b82f666b2ef6a989032ac61530e1ee32f/undo/undo.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default); for that, we will need a way to store and restore simulation keyframes - this functionality is tied to the current development of simulation logging.
update.title: [A-6] User command: Spawn / factory / create

Add the `UserCommands` system, which is meant to be the entry point for all user commands. This is just the beginning of the system, it eventually will:

* Provide a transport interface for **all commands** such as spawning, deleting, moving, etc.
* Provide a transport interface to **undo / redo** previous commands.
* Provide a transport interface to get a **history** of commands.

Right now, all it provides is a single command: spawn.

update.description:
# Overview

Add the `UserCommands` system, which is meant to be the entry point for all user commands. This is just the beginning of the system, it eventually will:

* Provide a transport interface for **all commands** such as spawning, deleting, moving, etc.
* Provide a transport interface to **undo / redo** previous commands.
* Provide a transport interface to get a **history** of commands.

Right now, all it provides is a single command: spawn.

# Requirements

* Pull request #130 (merged)
* [ign-msgs 86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/86/a-6-refactor-factory/diff) (merged)
* [sdf 499](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/499/a-6-support-root/diff)

# Try it out

The instructions in `empty.sdf` should be enough, let me know if you need more instructions.

![spawn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2909024988-spawn.gif)

# Future work

The current architecture is inspired on Gazebo's [UserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/physics/UserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) and [MEUserCmdManager](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/gui/model/MEUserCmdManager.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default).

The intention is that undo / redo will work as described on [this design document](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/b84d3c4b82f666b2ef6a989032ac61530e1ee32f/undo/undo.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default); for that, we will need a way to store and restore simulation keyframes - this functionality is tied to the current development of simulation logging.
update.title: [A-6] User command: Spawn (factory)

# Overview

Add the `UserCommands` system, which is meant to be the entry point for all user commands. This is just the beginning of the system, it eventually will:

* Provide a transport interface for **all commands** such as spawning, deleting, moving, etc.
* Provide a transport interface to **undo / redo** previous commands.
* Provide a transport interface to get a **history** of commands.

Right now, all it provides is a single command: spawn.
